Class Key

java.lang.Object
  Key

public class Key
extends java.lang.Object

Class the represents a keyboard key that has been pressed.

Version:
1.1
Author:
Chris Lovell, University of Southampton 2009

Constructor Summary

          Constructor used internall only - you do not need to use this

          Used to obtain the integer value Java uses to represent the key.

Constructor used internall only - you do not need to use this

keyChar -
Method Detail

isUp

public boolean isUp()
Used to determine if the up key has been pressed.

Returns:
true if the up key was pressed, false otherwise

isDown

public boolean isDown()
Used to determine if the down key has been pressed.

Returns:
true if the down key was pressed, false otherwise

isLeft

public boolean isLeft()
Used to determine if the left key has been pressed.

Returns:
true if the left key was pressed, false otherwise

isRight

public boolean isRight()
Used to determine if the right key has been pressed.

Returns:
true if the right key was pressed, false otherwise

getKeyChar

protected int getKeyChar()
Used to obtain the integer value Java uses to represent the key. This can be used to determine whether keys other than the cursor keys have been pressed.

Returns:
An integer representing the Java numerical value for the key.
